headline.main: 3 Reasons the Fed Will Likely Leave Rates Alone This Week
headline.print_headline: 3 Reasons the Fed Will Likely Leave Rates Alone This Week

docs.snippet: Six days before Americans choose a new president and Congress, the Federal Reserve is expected Wednesday to leave its benchmark interest rate alone but possibly signal that it expects to raise it in December....
docs.lead_paragraph: Six days before Americans choose a new president and Congress, the Federal Reserve is expected Wednesday to leave its benchmark interest rate alone but possibly signal that it expects to raise it in December.

headline.main: Convicted Russian Arms Dealer Bout Returns to U.S. Appeals Court
headline.print_headline: Convicted Russian Arms Dealer Bout Returns to U.S. Appeals Court

docs.snippet: Russian arms trafficker Viktor Bout, who is serving a 25-year prison sentence for agreeing to sell weapons to people he thought were Colombian rebels, urged a U.S. appeals court on Monday to overturn a ruling that denied him a new trial....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russian arms trafficker Viktor Bout, who is serving a 25-year prison sentence for agreeing to sell weapons to people he thought were Colombian rebels, urged a U.S. appeals court on Monday to overturn a ruling that denied him a new trial.

headline.main: Italy's Response to Commission on 2017 Budget 'Un-Constructive'-EU Official
headline.print_headline: Italy's Response to Commission on 2017 Budget 'Un-Constructive'-EU Official

docs.snippet: Italy's response to the European Commission's concerns regarding its 2017 draft budget assumptions has not been constructive, an EU official said on Monday, as Rome tries to avoid belt-tightening measures ahead of a Dec. 4 referendum....
docs.lead_paragraph: Italy's response to the European Commission's concerns regarding its 2017 draft budget assumptions has not been constructive, an EU official said on Monday, as Rome tries to avoid belt-tightening measures ahead of a Dec. 4 referendum.

headline.main: Petition of White House to Reverse Navy Ratings Change Tops Threshold
headline.print_headline: Petition of White House to Reverse Navy Ratings Change Tops Threshold

docs.snippet: A petition to the White House to halt the U.S. Navy's abolition of sailors' traditional ratings that are more than two centuries old has topped 100,000 signatures, above the number needed for an official response, according to the online petition ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A petition to the White House to halt the U.S. Navy's abolition of sailors' traditional ratings that are more than two centuries old has topped 100,000 signatures, above the number needed for an official response, according to the online petition site.

headline.main: Zika Ravages Testes of Mice; Study Raises Concern About Men
headline.print_headline: Zika Ravages Testes of Mice; Study Raises Concern About Men

docs.snippet: Zika virus ravages the testes of male mice, sharply reducing sperm counts and fertility, says a study that raises a new specter about its threat to people....
docs.lead_paragraph: Zika virus ravages the testes of male mice, sharply reducing sperm counts and fertility, says a study that raises a new specter about its threat to people.

headline.main: Ethiopia Says 2,000 Arrested and Released in Emergency
headline.print_headline: Ethiopia Says 2,000 Arrested and Released in Emergency

docs.snippet: An Ethiopian official said 2,000 people have been detained and later released under the country's state of emergency that was declared on October 8, 2016. The remarks came amid local media reports that thousands of people are being detained across...
docs.lead_paragraph: An Ethiopian official said 2,000 people have been detained and later released under the country's state of emergency that was declared on October 8, 2016. The remarks came amid local media reports that thousands of people are being detained across some parts of the country that have witnessed some of the worst violence in the past couple of weeks.
